page.title: 11BXL factory at Haltwhistle.
page.content: { BXL}stands for 'Bakelite Xylonite Limited'. About 30 years ago, most of the men in Haltwhistle worked down the pits, but these were being closed down so BXL moved into an old Government warehouse to make plastic bottles. They have 6 big silos to store the {polythene pellets}used to make the bottles. The pellets are melted into a liquid and the hot liquid is forced into moulds. They make{1 million bottles a day. Some bottles have names and pictures printed on them in English and other languages. They are filled with shampoo, washing-up, and other liquids at factories in Southampton, Liverpool and Manchester. The factory is very noisy. The factory works 24 hours a day. A lot of our mams work the 'twilight shift' from 5.30pm to 10.00pm.
